availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William A. McClanahan (Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Henderson County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Mary Ellen Greenwell McClanahan on June 30, 1836. Father of Thomas J. McClanahan, Richard McClanahan, John W. McClanahan, George A. McClanahan, Henry F. McClanahan, Alexander McClanahan, Mary A. McClanahan, Martha McClanahan, and Amelia McClanahan. Farmer in Henderson County in 1850 and 1860. Owned one enslaved person in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 2, p. 357; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 1, p. 61; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Division 1, p. 3; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, Corydon, p. 3; Kentucky, County Marriages, 1783-1965, Ancestry, Union County, Kentucky, June 30, 1836.
